name: Chassis and Strains
description: A strain is a cellular composition defined by a specific genetic composition. In all genetic engineering experiments, some strain was used as the starting point for modification.  This organism is often referred to as the 'host' or 'chassis' organism.

contents.params: All genetic engineering experiments today begin with some pre-existing biological sample that is already competent for translation and transcription.  Usually that sample is a cell like E. coli, yeast, or mammalian cells. Alternatively, that sample could be a reconstituted in vitro system made from transcription and translation proteins and RNAs that were isolated from some cell.  Regardless, there are core central dogma processes that must be present to have a biological system. When we speak of a chassis, we are referring to this sample that provides the central dogma processes.

E. coli remains a very common chassis for synthetic biology experiments and in industrial production.  It is also a workhorse for basic genetic manipulations even when the target organism is something different.  Thus it is important to know some things about this species.

Most strains of E. coli are from the MG1655 lineage, and can be thought of as minor mutants of that ancestral strain.  When people speak of the E. coli chassis, they are generally referring to this and other lineages that are indistinguishable from each other in terms of the central dogma processes.
Prokaryotes are extremely diverse in some ways, and extremely self-similar in other ways.

If you become a practicing genetic engineer, at some point you will be asked 'is this stuff dangerous'? The short answer is, sometimes.  There are unquestionably dangerous biological things that can be built. However, it is important to understand the axis of risk and how these emerge.  Though pathogenicity represents only one category of concerns, it is the concern that most people have about genetic engineering and thus important to understand.
Though bacteria lack organelles, they nevertheless have several distinct compartments.
